titlePage.note: Contains translations of sagas into French. First four items have translations on verso leaves and notes on recto. The remainder have translations on recto leaves and notes on verso.

msItem.title: Table of Contents
msItem.note: List of contents for first three items, followed by a note which reads: Tome II des Fornaldar sǫgur Norðrlanda. Reykjavík

msItem.title: Frá Fornljóti og ættmönnum hans (French)
Hversu Noregr byggðist (French)
msItem.incipit: Nous allons maintenant raconter comment à l'origine
msItem.explicit: Valdemarr roi des Danis apris qu'elle est fait faire prisonnier albritt.

msItem.title: Fundinn Noregr (French)
msItem.incipit: Il y avait un roi nommé Fornjótr
msItem.explicit: pere du jarl Rögnvaldr enn ríki ok enn uidhsvinni

msItem.note: Treated as separate texts in the MS

msItem.title: Af Upplendinga konungum (French)
msItem.incipit: Óláfr, fils d'Ingjaldr illrádhi roi du Svíaríki
msItem.explicit: du nom de qui provient alui des Ynglingar.

msItem.title: Sögubrot af nokkrum fornkonungum í Dana og Svíaveldi (French)
msItem.rubric: Sǫgubrot af nokkurum fornkonungum i Dana- ok Svíaveldi
msItem.note: Note on fol. 19r: Dans Fornaldar sǫgur Nordhrlanda Tome I. Edition de Reykjavík

msItem.title: Hervarar saga og Heiðreks (French)
msItem.incipit: On racconte qu' au temps jadis ce qui est au nord, en Finmörk
msItem.explicit: il ne fut roi que peu de temps.
msItem.note: Note on fol. 47r: Fornaldar sögur Nordhrlanda. Edition de Reykjavík. 1891.
Note on the front cover reads: Les énigmas de Gestumblindi appartiennent au chapitre onze de la Hervarar saga ok Heiðreks

msItem.title: Þorsteins þáttur skelks (French)
Þorsteins þáttr skelks
msItem.incipit: On raconte que l'été suivant le roi Óláfr (Tryggvason)
msItem.explicit: l'Ormr enn langi avec d'autres preux du roi.
msItem.note: Note on fol. 154r: Extrait de l'Óláfs saga Tryggvasonar du Flateyjarbók. T I. p. 406-418. Kristiania. 1860.
Fols. 154-161 have been mounted on tabs of previously excised leaves.

msItem.title: Bárðar saga Snæfellsáss (French)
msItem.incipit: Il y avait un roi appelé Dumbr
msItem.explicit: Et se termine ici la saga de Bárdhr Snæfellsáss et de son fils Gestr.
msItem.note: Note on fol. 162r: Edition de Reykjavík. 1902.

msItem.title: Þorvalds þáttur víðförla (French)
Þorvalds þáttr víðförla
msItem.incipit: Il y avait un homme appelé Eilífr örn
msItem.explicit: Trois hivers plus tard Thorvardhr fils de Spakklödhvarr fils bâlir une église à Víss.
msItem.note: Note on fol. 266r: Edition B. Kahle. Halle 1905.
Indices and supplementary material on fols. 301r-309r. Supplementary text from AM 262 fol. and Hungrvaka ch. 3 according to notes on fols. 301r and 309r

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation numbers are given in each opening. Foliated in red ink on recto leaves and in black ink on verso leaves. Red foliation is continuous, while black ink foliation restarts with each item.

layout.note: Some index material written in dual columns.

binding.p: Bound in contemporary paper bindings with later laminate reinforcement.

origin.note: Written some time after 1905, the date of Kahle's edition given on fol. 266r
